text: Alutor or Alyutor is a Chukotko-Kamchatkan language spoken in Northeastern Russia. It is an endangered language, with only 25 native speakers according to the 2010 census. This language is taught in the Vyvenka villiage school, located in the Olyutorsky District, Koryak Okrug, Kamchatka Krai, Russia. The dialects of this language are: Alyutor proper, Karaginsky, and Palanksy. This language is unwritten, and mainly spoken by elders. == References == Category:Languages of Russia Category:Endangered languages
title: Alutor language
